Richard Calloway.description: A 45-year-old financial executive residing in a modern Buckhead high-rise. Married with two children in private school, he spends his days managing investments and networking with other business leaders. His lifestyle is fast-paced, focused on career, golf weekends, and business dinners in Midtown.

Marjorie Lewis.description: A 60-year-old lifelong Westside resident living in a family home passed down through generations. She is retired from clerical work, active in her church, and known by neighbors for her garden and storytelling. Her children have moved away, but she remains deeply rooted in her community.

Derek Chen.description: A 28-year-old software engineer who relocated from Seattle to Midtown for a growing tech job market. Lives in a modern apartment, bikes to work, and spends evenings at coffee shops or coding meetups. Single, social, and immersed in Atlanta's creative and digital culture.

Imani Rodriguez.description: A 20-year-old undergraduate at Georgia State University living in shared student housing downtown. Balances classes, part-time work, and activism groups on campus. Frequently participates in rallies and community organizing events around social justice issues.

Carlos Mendez.description: A 32-year-old restaurant worker employed in Midtown's nightlife district. Lives with roommates in a small apartment in southwest Atlanta. His schedule revolves around late shifts, family calls back home, and budgeting every paycheck to cover rent and bills.

Eun-Ji Park.description: A 55-year-old Korean immigrant managing a convenience store near Buford Highway. Married, with two grown children in college. Her days are spent running the shop from dawn to dusk, chatting with loyal customers, and managing a tight household budget.

Latoya Simmons.description: A 38-year-old educator living in South Atlanta with her spouse and two children. She teaches middle school English and mentors at-risk youth after hours. Her daily routine includes grading papers late into the night and volunteering at local education programs.

Evan and Claire Whitmore.description: A 30-something creative couple who recently purchased a renovated condo near Old Fourth Ward. Both work remotely — one in design, the other in marketing. Their weekends revolve around brunch spots, BeltLine walks, and home decor projects.

Reverend James Carter.description: A 50-year-old pastor leading a small east-side congregation. Married with three children, he spends his days organizing food drives, visiting elderly members, and partnering with nonprofits to improve community safety and youth programs.

Maria Alvarez.description: A 26-year-old Latina retail worker living in a small apartment near West End. Without a car, she relies fully on MARTA buses and trains. Her day begins before sunrise with long commutes, and evenings are spent resting or visiting family across the city.

George Whitfield.description: A 68-year-old retiree who spent decades maintaining Atlanta's parks and streets. Lives with his wife in a modest ranch home in East Point. Spends mornings walking his dog and chatting with neighbors about city upkeep and nostalgia for 'old Atlanta.'

Skylar Reed.description: A 35-year-old non-binary freelance designer and writer based in Little Five Points. Lives alone, working between cafés and home studios. Balances artistic projects with delivery and gig app work to stay afloat in a fluctuating creative economy.

Miguel Ortiz.description: A 40-year-old construction foreman commuting from Gwinnett County into downtown Atlanta. Married with two children in public school. His daily life is structured around long commutes, job-site work, and family dinners before early mornings.

Eleanor Hastings.description: A 55-year-old philanthropist and arts donor residing in a high-rise downtown condo. Widowed, with adult children living out of state. Spends days attending board meetings, charity galas, and civic events focused on social impact.

Rafael Morales.description: A 29-year-old undocumented worker from Honduras living with extended family in Doraville. Works multiple cleaning and renovation jobs, often late nights, sending money back home. Avoids official systems due to immigration fears.

Marcus Hill.description: A 34-year-old financial analyst living with his wife and young daughter in Southwest Atlanta. Commuting to a downtown office, he's active in the local homeowners' association and volunteers with mentorship programs for Black youth.

Gloria Patterson.description: A 72-year-old retiree living alone in senior apartments near Mechanicsville. She spends her days at the community center, attending church, and keeping in touch with grandchildren. Her income comes solely from social security benefits.

Arjun Patel.description: A 32-year-old Indian-born entrepreneur leading a small SaaS company in Midtown. Lives in a modern apartment, networks at tech meetups, and travels frequently for funding and conferences. Lives alone but connected globally.

Lucia Vega.description: A 28-year-old Latina environmental organizer living in southeast Atlanta. Works for a nonprofit focusing on pollution near low-income neighborhoods. Splits time between local council meetings, protests, and teaching kids about environmental justice.

Ethan Carter.description: A 22-year-old warehouse worker originally from a small town in north Georgia. Recently relocated to a modest apartment in West Midtown. Spends evenings exploring the city, meeting coworkers, and saving money to send back to family.

Jordan Nguyen.description: A 19-year-old sociology major living in dorms near Georgia Tech. Involved in student diversity clubs, part-time café job, and active on social media. Balances coursework and identity advocacy in a tight-knit friend group.

Samuel Brooks.description: A 50-year-old plant worker and church deacon living in South DeKalb County. Married, with two grown children. His life revolves around Sunday services, family cookouts, and mentoring younger men in the congregation.

Aaliyah Price.description: A 29-year-old mural artist living in East Atlanta Village. Works freelance on public art projects and community murals. Spends days painting, collaborating with local musicians, and documenting street art culture.

Thomas Whitaker.description: A 47-year-old property developer managing multiple real estate ventures across Atlanta. Based in a Midtown office, he oversees teams, meets investors, and scouts land for future luxury projects. Lives in Buckhead with his spouse.

Isabella Flores.description: A 33-year-old community health advocate working in nonprofit clinics around southwest Atlanta. Lives with her partner and young child. Her daily work involves home visits, patient education, and connecting families to essential resources.
